statement.text: A multidisciplinary limb preservation team integrates vascular surgery, podiatry, wound care, infectious disease, endocrinology, and rehabilitation to optimize outcomes for patients with chronic limb-threatening ischemia and diabetic foot disease.
statement.formal: Limb_Team: Vascular + Podiatry + Wound + ID + Endocrine + Rehab â†’ Improved_Limb_Salvage

explanation.intuition: Saving a threatened limb is like putting out a complex fire - you need multiple specialists working together. The vascular surgeon restores blood flow, but you also need someone to offload pressure, control infection, manage diabetes, and rehabilitate the patient.
explanation.key_insight: Limb salvage rates improve significantly (30-50% reduction in major amputation) when care is coordinated through a multidisciplinary team rather than siloed specialists. The team approach ensures no critical element (perfusion, infection, offloading, glycemic control) is neglected.
explanation.technical_details: Core team: vascular surgeon (revascularization), podiatrist (debridement, offloading, minor amputation), wound care specialist (advanced therapies), infectious disease (antibiotic stewardship), endocrinologist (diabetes optimization). Extended team: orthopedic surgeon, plastic surgery, prosthetist, physical therapy, social work, nutrition. Structure: regular case conferences, shared protocols, expedited referral pathways, quality metrics tracking.

clinical_pearls: Team approach reduces major amputation rates by 30-50%
Weekly case conferences ensure coordinated care
Every CLTI patient needs vascular, wound, and diabetes optimization
